tweets.text:
Six fire engines are still at the large fire on Carlisle Street in #Sheffield.

Firefighters are working with partner organisations @SheffCouncil, @EnvAgencyYNE to bring the fire under control.

People are advised to keep doors and windows closed if there is smoke in their area. https://t.co/Jhn8vd28Lh

tweets.text: Officers are attending the scene of a fire at a scrap metal yard in Sheffield, working with @SYFR to manage the risk of pollution from water used to fight the blaze. This includes dye-testing local drains, which may lead to a harmless discolouration to nearby watercourses. https://t.co/EB4mJUxLuA

Sent a request to the @EnvAgency for the 2020 sewage discharge data for the individual sites, specifically Chesham STW. They are not the most responsive, especially when it might be embarrassing. The @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK failed to point out many are a breach of permit.

tweets.text: @TigerGaret @EnvAgency Over 63 years!!!(???)

This ITV report is as shocking as yesterday‚Äôs news from the @EnvAgency . This is the death of an iconic river in slow motion - largely due to unmitigated agricultural pollution. The intensive poultry industry needs to clean itself up ASAP for starters @thenoblefoods https://t.co/d1pmbc1Fug

@EnvAgency 25 years old, what a legacy.

‚ÄúEngland‚Äôs rivers have become nothing more than an extension of the sewage system, polluted, poisoned and exploited for profit." https://t.co/NYtYA46c3g

Self-reporting by water companies = abject failure and river habitats are paying the price. It‚Äôs time for the @EnvAgency to carry out its regulatory duties to the full. Every sewage spill increases profit - the system was destined to fail @Dunne4Ludlow https://t.co/0BMh4zjZDz

tweets.text: Can‚Äôt quite believe it but the @EnvAgency is 25 today! I was there at the start joining as an Assistant Hydrologist. tweets.text: @EnvAgency @gazilapod Maybe it is now time to introduce National Service, not for the military but for environment management, with a particular focus on clearing litter and fly tipping. Getting our youth to respect the environment will pay dividends into the future.
How on earth is this allowed to happen @EnvAgency ? Whatever the ‚Äúreason‚Äù https://t.co/kc9dROI2HF

This is happening even without the impact of EDF Sizewell C's 10+ metres sea wall. No wonder Suffolk residents are alarmed EDF won't disclose design of sea wall & EDF believe it's ok to only protect their own site disregarding impact on neighbours 
@PINSgov @EnvAgency @The_ONR https://t.co/FX6CvLkfu7

Bearing in mind that the 30-minute peak in the previous monitoring exercise was 44.5, it‚Äôs clear my constituents are being subjected to a major and ongoing environmental incident.

I trust the culprits will be properly held accountable by @EnvAgencyMids.
Coastal erosion has become part of life on the Suffolk coast and much of our beautiful UK coastline - join us to help the fight against climate change and help #StopSizewellC https://t.co/UJXt5VlXf9

#Water firms discharged raw #sewage into rivers and coastal waters in England more than 400,000 times last yr, says @EnvAgency.  How did they manage to get away with this behaviour  so long? Is it the need to keep bills down? @AnglingTrust @angling_times @CraigBennett3

@MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe Risk to health, we need to be moved out to somewhere we won't be poisoned Whalleys Quarry & it needs to happen now, can't stand another night like last night. #stopthestink

And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

@Kimberl43789497 @LoneRanger77777 @EmmaHowardBoyd @sxsw @nytimes @EnvAgency @topnigel @RhianMariThomas @ChiefExecCCC @leahstokes @hindououmar @swetac @JosephMajkut @SominiSengupta @GFI_green @StinkStopthe This woman is useless yet so unbelievably proud of herself üôÑü§¨ her arrogance knocks me sick just like the poisonous gases she allows me and my partner to be exposed to in our home ü§Æü§Æ

tweets.text:
@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @PHE_WestMids @PHE_uk They're suffocating babies 
How are you going to reconcile this?
More reports?
More meetings?
More tweets?
This is ridiculous 
People are choking in their homes and have been for years.
The more they complain the more they suffer.

@StinkStopthe @LoneRanger77777 @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Poisoned is exactly what's happening here.
Thousands of people can't be wrong.

tweets.text: @YorkBikeBelles @EnvAgencyYNE What really? Why would it need to be open to vehicles there? Is that just to make access for flood works easier? Because no need for thru route to anywhere surely?

How many face coverings did you see littered on your last beach walk?

Litter spoils the places we enjoy and can make its way into the sea and possibly harm marine life.

Bring a bag for your #litter when you go outdoors and take it home to dispose of.

#BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/5XocwdLO82

Works have started on the 1st step of Phase 2 of the #Earby Flood Alleviation Scheme. The works will reduce flood risk from Victoria Clough with the construction of a flood embankment, which will store flood water upstream of Earby. Work is expected to finish by mid-April. #FCERM https://t.co/LcFKvCif2z

tweets.text:
What are storm overflows, and why do we use them?

Storm overflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our homes or streets during periods of heavy rain or storms.

Watch our video to find out more about storm overflows: https://t.co/VBJFNTBAVE

urls.title: What is a storm overflow and how do they work?
urls.description: Heard of a storm overflow but not sure what it is? Watch this to find out what they are, why they operate and what we do to minimise their impact on the wate...

tweets.text: We are working with @EnvAgency  and  @FOIM_IlkleyMoor on a natural flood management  project to slow the flow of water from Ilkley Moor into Backstone Beck which flows into the River Wharfe. This work will also help peat bogs to form which store carbon.   https://t.co/Eh3svE5omT https://t.co/TtOAlMqpSr

urls.title: Natural Flood Management work continues on Ilkley Moor
urls.description: Natural Flood Management work continues on Ilkley Moor
